Newtonian Mechanics.name: Newton's Second Law
Newtonian Mechanics.description: F: force, m: mass, a: acceleration

Newtonian Mechanics.name: Kinetic Energy
Newtonian Mechanics.description: KE: kinetic energy, m: mass, v: velocity

Newtonian Mechanics.name: Gravitational Potential Energy
Newtonian Mechanics.description: U: gravitational potential energy, m: mass, g: gravitational acceleration, h: height

Newtonian Mechanics.name: Work
Newtonian Mechanics.description: W: work, F: force, d: displacement, θ: angle between force and displacement

Newtonian Mechanics.name: Newton's Third Law
Newtonian Mechanics.description: F_{12}: force exerted by object 2 on object 1, F_{21}: force exerted by object 1 on object 2; for every action there is an equal and opposite reaction

Newtonian Mechanics.name: Linear Momentum
Newtonian Mechanics.description: p: momentum, m: mass, v: velocity

Newtonian Mechanics.name: Impulse
Newtonian Mechanics.description: J: impulse, \Delta p: change in momentum, F: force, \Delta t: time interval

Newtonian Mechanics.name: Centripetal Force
Newtonian Mechanics.description: F_c: centripetal force, m: mass, v: velocity, r: radius of the circular path

Newtonian Mechanics.name: Power
Newtonian Mechanics.description: P: power, F: force, v: velocity; represents the rate of doing work

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Coulomb's Constant
Electricity & Magnetism.description: k: Coulomb's constant, ε₀: vacuum permittivity

Electricity & Magnetism.description: E: electric field, q: point charge, r: distance, r̂: unit vector, k: Coulomb's constant

Electricity & Magnetism.description: λ: linear charge density, Q: total charge, L: length

Electricity & Magnetism.description: σ: surface charge density, Q: total charge, A: area

Electricity & Magnetism.description: Φ_E: electric flux, Q_enc: enclosed charge, ε₀: vacuum permittivity

Electricity & Magnetism.description: V: electric potential, k: Coulomb's constant, q: charge, r: radial distance

Electricity & Magnetism.description: V: voltage, I: current, R: resistance

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Magnetic Flux
Electricity & Magnetism.description: Φ_B: magnetic flux, B: magnetic field, dA: differential area, S: surface

Electricity & Magnetism.description: Req: equivalent resistance, R_i: individual resistances

Electricity & Magnetism.description: Req: equivalent resistance, R_i: individual resistances

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Magnetic Torque on a Coil
Electricity & Magnetism.description: τ: torque, N: number of loops, I: current, A: area, B: magnetic field, θ: angle between B and the normal to the coil

Electricity & Magnetism.description: F: force, I: current, l: length vector of the wire, B: magnetic field

Electricity & Magnetism.name: RC Circuit Discharge
Electricity & Magnetism.description: Q: charge at time t, Q₀: initial charge, R: resistance, C: capacitance, t: time

Electricity & Magnetism.description: J: current density, I: current, A: cross-sectional area

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Magnetic Field of a Long Straight Conductor
Electricity & Magnetism.description: B: magnetic field, μ₀: permeability of free space, I: current, r: distance from the conductor

Electricity & Magnetism.description: ν: frequency, λ: wavelength, c: speed of light

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Speed of Light
Electricity & Magnetism.description: c: speed of light in vacuum

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Electric and Magnetic Field Relation in EM Waves
Electricity & Magnetism.description: E: electric field amplitude, B: magnetic field amplitude, c: speed of light

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Ampère's Law with Maxwell's Correction
Electricity & Magnetism.description: B: magnetic field, dl: differential length, I_enc (or i_C): conduction/enclosed current, ε₀: permittivity of free space, dΦ_E/dt: rate/time derivative of electric flux, μ₀: permeability of free space
search_terms: rate of change of electric flux

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Self-Inductance
Electricity & Magnetism.description: L: inductance, Φ_B: magnetic flux, I: current

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Power Dissipated in a Resistor
Electricity & Magnetism.description: P_loss: power loss, I: current, R: resistance

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Electrical Power
Electricity & Magnetism.description: P: power, V: voltage, I: current

Electricity & Magnetism.description: φ: phase angle, X_L: inductive reactance, X_C: capacitive reactance, R: resistance

Electricity & Magnetism.description: X_L: inductive reactance, ω: angular frequency, L: inductance

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Capacitive Reactance
Electricity & Magnetism.description: X_C: capacitive reactance, ω: angular frequency, C: capacitance

Electricity & Magnetism.description: Z: impedance, R: resistance, X_L: inductive reactance, X_C: capacitive reactance

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Voltage Amplitude in an AC Circuit
Electricity & Magnetism.description: V: voltage amplitude, Z: impedance, I: current amplitude

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Average AC Power
Electricity & Magnetism.description: P_av: average power, V: voltage amplitude, I: current amplitude, φ: phase angle

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Coulomb's Law
Electricity & Magnetism.description: F: force, k: Coulomb's constant, q₁ and q₂: point charges, r: distance between charges

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Lorentz Force
Electricity & Magnetism.description: F: force, q: charge, E: electric field, v: velocity, B: magnetic field

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Biot–Savart Law
Electricity & Magnetism.description: dB: differential magnetic field, μ₀: permeability of free space, I: current, dl: differential length, r: distance, r̂: unit vector from current element to point

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Electric Potential
Electricity & Magnetism.description: V: electric potential, E: electric field, dl: differential length, C: integration path

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Capacitance
Electricity & Magnetism.description: C: capacitance, Q: charge, V: potential difference

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Energy Stored in a Capacitor
Electricity & Magnetism.description: U: energy stored, C: capacitance, V: potential difference

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Inductance
Electricity & Magnetism.description: L: inductance, N: number of turns, Φ_B: magnetic flux, I: current

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Energy Stored in an Inductor
Electricity & Magnetism.description: U: energy stored, L: inductance, I: current

Electricity & Magnetism.name: EMF (Battery with Internal Resistance)
Electricity & Magnetism.description: ε: electromotive force, V: terminal voltage, I: current, r: internal resistance

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Faraday's Law of Induction
Electricity & Magnetism.description: ε: induced electromotive force, Φ: magnetic flux, t: time

Electricity & Magnetism.name: Faraday's Law for a Coil
Electricity & Magnetism.description: ε: induced electromotive force, N: number of turns, Φ: magnetic flux, t: time

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Maximum Power (Harmonic Wave)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: P_{max}: maximum power for a harmonic wave, μ: linear mass density, F: force or tension, ω: angular frequency, A: amplitude

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Average Power (Harmonic Wave)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: P_{av}: average power for a harmonic wave, μ: linear mass density, F: force or tension, ω: angular frequency, A: amplitude

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Intensity of a Spherical Wave
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: I₁: intensity of a spherical wave, P: power, r: distance from the source

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Young's Modulus
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Y: Young's modulus, F⊥: perpendicular force, A: cross-sectional area, Δl: change in length, l₀: original length

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Bulk Modulus
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: B: bulk modulus, Δp: change in pressure, ΔV: change in volume, V₀: original volume

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Shear Modulus
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: S: shear modulus, F‖: force parallel to the surface, A: area, x: lateral displacement, h: thickness

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Strain Tensor (Small Deformations)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ε_{ij}: strain tensor components for small deformations, s: displacement vector

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Strain in Isotropic Materials
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ε_{xx}: strain in isotropic materials, Y: Young's modulus, σ: stress, ν: Poisson's ratio

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Energy Density in a Mechanical Wave
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ε: energy density, μ: linear mass density, v: wave speed, ∂ξ/∂x: spatial derivative of displacement

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Reflection Coefficient
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: y_{r0}: reflected wave amplitude, y_0: incident wave amplitude, Z_1 and Z_2: acoustic impedances

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Transmission Coefficient
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: y_{t0}: transmitted wave amplitude, y_0: incident wave amplitude, Z_1 and Z_2: acoustic impedances

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Wave Impedance (String)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Z: wave impedance for a string, μ: linear mass density, S: tension

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Wave Impedance (Mass-Spring System)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Z: wave impedance for a mass-spring system, K: spring constant, μ: mass density

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Superposition of Two Waves (Beat Phenomenon)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Resultant displacement from the superposition of two waves, showing beat formation; ξ₀: amplitude, k and ω: average wave number and angular frequency, Δk and Δω: half differences

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Fourier Series Expansion
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.formula: f(x) = \frac{a_0}{2} + \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\left[a_n \cos\left(\frac{2\pi n x}{P}\right) + b_n \sin\left(\frac{2\pi n x}{P}\right)\right]
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Expansion of a periodic function f(x) into sines and cosines; a₀, aₙ, bₙ are Fourier coefficients and P is the period

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Fourier Cosine Coefficients
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: aₙ: cosine Fourier coefficients for the function f(x) over period P

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Fourier Sine Coefficients
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: bₙ: sine Fourier coefficients for the function f(x) over period P

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Surface Energy
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: E: surface energy due to surface tension, α: surface tension coefficient, ΔA: change in area

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Laplace Pressure
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Δp: pressure difference across a curved surface, α: surface tension, R₁ and R₂: principal radii of curvature

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Hydrostatic Equilibrium
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Represents hydrostatic equilibrium in a fluid where the pressure gradient balances gravitational force; ρ: density, g: gravitational acceleration

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Continuity Equation
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Expresses conservation of mass in fluid dynamics; ρ: density, v: velocity field

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Volumetric Flow Rate
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Φ_v: volumetric flow rate, v: fluid velocity, dA: differential area

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Material Derivative of Velocity
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: D_t v: material derivative of velocity, representing the time rate of change following a fluid parcel

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Navier-Stokes Equation (Simplified)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Simplified Navier-Stokes equation for fluid flow; g: gravitational acceleration, p: pressure, ρ: density, μ: dynamic viscosity

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Vorticity
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ω: vorticity, a measure of local rotation in a fluid; v: velocity field

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Vorticity Transport Equation
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Describes the evolution of vorticity in a fluid; ν: kinematic viscosity

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Kinematic Viscosity
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ν: kinematic viscosity, μ: dynamic viscosity, ρ: density

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Reynolds Number
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Re: Reynolds number, a dimensionless quantity in fluid mechanics; ρ: density, v: velocity, L: characteristic length, μ: dynamic viscosity

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Velocity from Stream Function
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Expresses the velocity field in terms of the stream function ψ for 2D incompressible flow

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Bernoulli's Equation
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Bernoulli's equation for inviscid flow; p: pressure, ρ: density, g: gravitational acceleration, z: height, v: velocity, k: constant

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Transport Theorem
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Reynolds transport theorem relating the time derivative of a property B for a control volume V(t); ρ: density, β: scalar property, v: velocity, n̂: unit normal

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Harmonic Plane Wave (1D)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ξ: displacement, ξ₀: amplitude, k: wave number, ω: angular frequency, φ: phase

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Harmonic Plane Wave (3D)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ξ: displacement, ξ₀: amplitude, k: wave vector, r: position vector, ω: angular frequency, φ: phase

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Wave Equation (1D)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Relates the second spatial derivative to the second time derivative; v: wave speed

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Wave Equation (3D)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Three-dimensional wave equation using the Laplacian; v: wave speed

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Phase Velocity
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: v: phase velocity, ω: angular frequency, k: wave number

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Group Velocity
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: v₍g₎: group velocity, the derivative of angular frequency with respect to wave number

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Non-dispersive Wave Speed in Elastic Media
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: v: wave speed, E: elastic modulus, ρ: mass density

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Mechanical Stress in Elastic Media
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: stress: mechanical stress, E: elastic modulus, strain: relative deformation

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Transverse Wave on a String
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: v: wave speed, S: tension, μ: linear mass density

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Longitudinal Wave in Fluids
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: v: speed of sound, B: bulk modulus, ρ: density

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Longitudinal Wave in Solids
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: v: speed of sound, Y: Young's modulus, ρ: density

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Average Value over Wavelength
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: A: average value, λ: wavelength, computed by integrating over one wavelength

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Average Value over Period
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ⟨A⟩: average value, T: period, computed by integrating over one period

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Average Energy per Unit Length (String)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ε: energy per unit length, μ: linear mass density, ω: angular frequency, ξ₀: amplitude

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Average Energy per Unit Volume (Plane Wave)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ε: energy per unit volume, ρ: density, ω: angular frequency, ξ₀: amplitude

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Average Power (String Wave)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: P: power, v: wave speed, calculated as the product of wave speed and energy density

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Intensity of a Plane Wave
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: I: intensity, v: wave speed, ρ: density; intensity is the product of wave speed and energy density

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Average Momentum Density
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: π: momentum density, calculated as energy density divided by wave speed

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Ideal Gas Law
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: p: pressure, V: volume, N: number of molecules, k_B: Boltzmann's constant, T: temperature

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Heat Capacity at Constant Pressure
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Cₚ: heat capacity at constant pressure, Q: heat, T: temperature

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Heat Capacity at Constant Volume
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: C_V: heat capacity at constant volume, Q: heat, T: temperature

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Adiabatic Process (Ideal Gas)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: p: pressure, V: volume, γ: adiabatic index; describes a process with no heat exchange

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Adiabatic Constant
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: γ: adiabatic constant (ratio of heat capacities), Cₚ: heat capacity at constant pressure, C_V: heat capacity at constant volume

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Bulk Modulus (Ideal Gas, Adiabatic)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: B: bulk modulus, p: pressure, γ: adiabatic constant

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Speed of Sound in Gas
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: v: speed of sound, p: pressure, ρ: density, T: temperature, k_B: Boltzmann's constant, m: molecular mass

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Sound Pressure
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Δp: sound pressure, B: bulk modulus, ∂ξ/∂x: spatial derivative of displacement

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Sound Level
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: β: sound level in decibels, I: intensity, I₀: reference intensity (10⁻¹² W/m²)

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Doppler Effect (Sound Waves)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ν_O: observed frequency, ν_S: source frequency, v_O: observer velocity, v_S: source velocity, v: wave velocity

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Shock Waves Relation
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: sin α: sine of the shock angle, v: wave speed, v_S: shock speed

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Maxwell's Equations (Integral Form)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.formula: \oint \mathbf{E}\cdot d\mathbf{A} = \frac{q}{\varepsilon_0}, \quad \oint \mathbf{B}\cdot d\mathbf{A} = 0, \quad \oint \mathbf{E}\cdot d\mathbf{l} = -\frac{d}{dt}\int \mathbf{B}\cdot d\mathbf{A}, \quad \oint \mathbf{B}\cdot d\mathbf{l} = \mu_0 I + \mu_0\varepsilon_0\frac{d}{dt}\int \mathbf{E}\cdot d\mathbf{A}
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: E: electric field, B: magnetic field, q: charge, I: current, ε₀: permittivity of free space, μ₀: permeability of free space

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Maxwell's Equations (Differential Form)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: E: electric field, B: magnetic field, ρ: charge density, j: current density, ε₀: permittivity, μ₀: permeability

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Lorentz Force
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: F: force, q: charge, E: electric field, v: velocity, B: magnetic field

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Wave Equation in Vacuum for EM Fields
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: E: electric field, B: magnetic field, c: speed of light, ε₀: permittivity, μ₀: permeability

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Energy Density in EM Field
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: u: energy density, E: electric field, B: magnetic field, ε₀: permittivity, μ₀: permeability

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Intensity of an EM Wave
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: I: intensity, c: speed of light, E: electric field (time-averaged square gives intensity)

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Poynting Vector
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: S: Poynting vector representing the power per unit area carried by an EM wave; E: electric field, B: magnetic field

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Momentum in an EM Wave
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: π: momentum density, S: Poynting vector, μ₀: permeability, ε₀: permittivity

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Electric Dipole Moment
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: p: electric dipole moment, q: charge, d: separation distance

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Magnetic Dipole Moment
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: m: magnetic dipole moment, I: current, A: area of the current loop

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Radiated Power (Electric Dipole)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ⟨P⟩: average radiated power, p₀: dipole moment amplitude, ω: angular frequency, ε₀: permittivity, c: speed of light

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Radiated Power (Magnetic Dipole)
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ⟨P⟩: average radiated power, m₀: magnetic dipole moment amplitude, ω: angular frequency, μ₀: permeability, c: speed of light

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Malus' Law
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: I(θ): transmitted intensity, I₀: initial intensity, θ: angle between polarization directions

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Linear Media Relations
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: P: polarization, E: electric field, D: electric displacement, M: magnetization, H: magnetic field, χₑ and χₘ: susceptibilities, ε₀, εᵣ, μ₀, μᵣ: permittivity and permeability parameters

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Gauss's Law for Electric Displacement
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: D: electric displacement, q_free: free charge, dA: differential area, over a closed surface

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Gauss's Law for Magnetic Fields
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: B: magnetic field, dA: differential area; indicates that magnetic monopoles do not exist

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Faraday's Law of Induction
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: ε: induced electromotive force, Φ: magnetic flux, t: time

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Lorentz Transformation
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: x': transformed position, t': transformed time, γ: Lorentz factor, v: relative velocity, c: speed of light

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Time Dilation
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Δt: dilated time, Δt₀: proper time, γ: Lorentz factor

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Length Contraction
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: Δx: contracted length, Δx₀: proper length, γ: Lorentz factor

Waves & Fluid Mechanics.name: Relativistic Velocity Addition
Waves & Fluid Mechanics.description: v₍AC₎: resultant velocity, v₍AB₎ and v₍BC₎: component velocities, c: speed of light

Relativity.name: Mass-Energy Equivalence
Relativity.description: E: energy, m: mass, c: speed of light

Relativity.name: Lorentz Factor
Relativity.description: γ: Lorentz factor, v: velocity, c: speed of light

Thermodynamics.name: Ideal Gas Law
Thermodynamics.description: P: pressure, V: volume, n: amount of substance, R: gas constant, T: temperature

Thermodynamics.name: First Law of Thermodynamics
Thermodynamics.description: ΔU: change in internal energy, Q: heat added to the system, W: work done by the system

Quantum Mechanics.name: Time-Dependent Schrödinger Equation
Quantum Mechanics.description: i: imaginary unit, ħ: reduced Planck's constant, Ψ: wavefunction, r: position vector, t: time, Ĥ: Hamiltonian operator

Quantum Mechanics.name: Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle
Quantum Mechanics.description: Δx: uncertainty in position, Δp: uncertainty in momentum, ħ: reduced Planck's constant

Optics.name: Thin Lens Formula
Optics.description: f: focal length, d_o: object distance, d_i: image distance
